title: 108_s2376
content: The "Working Family Tax Relief Act of 2004" repeals scheduled reductions in child tax credit, marriage penalty relief, and the 10-percent rate bracket. The "Working Family Tax Relief Act of 2004" amends the child tax credit to allow a $1,000 credit per qualifying child and provides marriage penalty relief in the standard deduction for joint returns. The "Working Family Tax Relief Act of 2004" provides marriage penalty relief by adjusting the standard deduction amounts based on filing status. The amendment eliminates the marriage penalty in the 15-percent income tax bracket for taxable years beginning after the enactment. The "Working Family Tax Relief Act of 2004" provides marriage penalty relief by adjusting the tax brackets. For taxable years after December 31, 2004, the maximum taxable income in the 15% bracket is set at 200% of the previous amount, with adjustments in other brackets as well. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to remove specific dollar amounts for taxable years. Inflation adjustments are made for taxable years after 2003, with changes to cost-of-living adjustments. The provisions of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 are made permanent, including specific sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The amendments made by this section will apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2004. SEC. 3. Extension of minimum tax relief to individuals by amending exemption amounts for taxable years starting after December 31, 2004.
